The Institute for Education by Radio was established in
1930 at Ohio State University. Its purpose is to provide an
annual meeting for joint discussion by broadcasters and educa¬
tors of the problems of educational broadcasting. The program
is devoted chiefly to a consideration of the techniques of educa¬
tion by radio. The Institute passes no resolutions and its officers
are limited to a director, W. W. Charters, an executive secre¬
tary, I. Keith Tyler, and a secretary, M. Margariete Ralls, all
of the Bureau of Educational Research. The committee on the
annual program for 1940 consisted of the three officers with the
addition of R. C. Higgy, Director, and Friel Heimlich, Program
Supervisor, of Station WOSU, J. Wayne Wrightstone, formerly
Associate Director, Evaluation of School Broadcasts, Irwin A.
Johnson, Director of Developmental Programs, Station WBNS
and Ed Bronson, Program Director, Station WCOL.
